description: A rich, deeply flavorful, and hearty stew made from a mix of cleaned tripe, intestines, and other organ meats, slow-cooked with aromatic spices until tender. A classic for those who appreciate bold flavors.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Offal stew is a cherished dish, often enjoyed with a cold beer or local waragi (gin). It's a testament to the 'nose-to-tail' eating philosophy, minimizing waste and maximizing flavor. While it requires careful preparation, the result is considered a true delicacy.

ingredients.name: Beef Tripe
ingredients.notes: Cleaned and cut into bite-sized pieces

ingredients.name: Beef Intestines
ingredients.notes: Thoroughly cleaned and cut into pieces

steps.instruction: Thoroughly clean the offal. Rub the tripe and intestines with lemon juice/vinegar and coarse salt. Rinse thoroughly under running water. Repeat until the water runs clear and the odor is minimized.

Place the cleaned offal in a large pot. Add the sliced onion, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Boil vigorously for 10 minutes, then discard this water. This first boil further removes impurities.

Rinse the offal again and return it to the clean pot. Add fresh water until the offal is covered. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 60-90 minutes, or until the tripe is tender but still slightly chewy. Skim off any foam that rises.

cooking_indicators.visual: tripe becomes pale and tender, easily pierced with a fork

steps.instruction: Drain the pre-cooked offal and let it cool slightly. Cut it all into uniform, bite-sized pieces. Discard the boiling water.
In the clean, large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the curry powder and cumin powder. Cook for 30 seconds to release their aromas.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes, mashing them until they form a thick paste and the oil begins to separate.
Add the pre-cooked offal pieces to the pot. Stir well to coat everything in the spiced tomato base. Cook for 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

Pour in 4 cups of water, add salt, and add the whole chili pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45-60 minutes until the stew has thickened and the offal is very tender.

cooking_indicators.visual: stew is rich and thickened, offal is very tender

steps.instruction: Stir in the sliced green bell pepper in the last 10 minutes of cooking. Adjust salt and spice levels to your taste.
Serve the hot offal stew in a deep bowl with its rich gravy.

serving_suggestions: Traditionally served with Posho (Ugali), Chapati, or Matoke. A side of Kachumbari (fresh tomato and onion salad) helps cut through the richness. Pairs well with a cold beer.
